adapters.text: Adapters are the interfaces to various devices, services and technologies. An adapter acts like a "translator" that converts data from a specific device or protocol into a standardized format that ioBroker understands. At the same time, it enables commands from ioBroker to be passed on to the devices or services.
adapters.title: ADAPTERS

community.mainText: The community has been a central part of ioBroker’s development from the very beginning. Although the project was originally designed to be language-neutral, over time it turned out that the German-speaking community became the most active—probably because ioBroker originated in Germany. Today, the ioBroker forum is the first place to go for questions, problem-solving, and exchanging ideas with other users. There you’ll find a wide range of tutorials, scripts, and best practices to help you get the most out of ioBroker. In addition to the forum, there is also a very active community on Facebook and Discord, where people discuss, help each other, and share new ideas every day. Whether you’re a beginner or an expert, you’ll always find support—and you can contribute your own knowledge to help others.
community.secondary: Join the community and shape the future of ioBroker!
community.title: COMMUNITY

platform.head: ioBroker is much more than just software – it’s a powerful and flexible open‑source platform for smart home and IoT integration.
platform.sub1: With ioBroker you can connect devices from different manufacturers and protocols such as Zigbee, KNX, MQTT, Homematic, Modbus and many more and control them centrally. This creates a vendor‑independent smart home that can be adapted and expanded to your needs.
platform.sub2: ioBroker is for everyone – from beginners who create simple automations with a few clicks to enthusiasts building complex scenarios with JavaScript, Blockly or Node‑RED. The entire control runs through an intuitive graphical interface, without having to edit complicated configuration files.
